overview.ovdesc:
This application stores the details of T24
applications for which DM Module processing should be invoked; it also specifies the Customer Types in the applications, for which documents should be tracked.
This is a Company specific application and
records of this application could not be reversed.

desc.p: Specifies Mnemonic for the application, for Document Tracking purposes.
Maximum four and minimum two alphanumeric characters with the first character alphabet.
Once authorized can not be changed.

t.desc:
Specifies whether an error message is to be displayed or an override message is to be displayed while tracking non-contract specific documents, which have already been tracked by a transaction different from that of
the application.
Validation Rules:
Optional field
Acceptable values are YES or NO or NULL
If Yes is given, Override will be generated otherwise Error will be generated.

desc.p: Specifies the names of customer fields in the Application. Documents would be tracked only for the customer(s) whose IDs equal the values of the fields defined here.
If no field is defined, then documents for this application could be tracked only from a related application.
When an FT is input, T24 will track required documents for customers whose IDs equal to the values of the fields DEBIT.CUSTOMER and CREDIT.CUSTOMER in the FT.
When a SEC.TRADE is input, since CUSTOMER.NO is a multi-value field, T24 will track required documents for all customers whose IDs equal to the values of the field CUSTOMER.NO in the SEC.TRADE.

In the above case, documents will not be tracked when a record is directly input in SECURITY.MASTER. However, if SECURITY.MASTER is defined as a related application for SEC.TRADE (in the application DOCUMENT.REQUIRED), when a record is input in SEC.TRADE, documents for SECURITY.MASTER will be also tracked along with those required for SEC.TRADE.
Value allowed only if the application specified in the ID is a CUS or FIN type application (Value of the field CLASSIFICATION in FILE.CONTROL is CUS or FIN for the application specified in the ID).
Any valid field defined in the Standard Selection of the application. However care must to taken to define only those fields which represent a Customer ID.
For CUSTOMER application, only allowed value would be @ID i.e. the ID of the Customer record itself.
Record ID could be any valid T24 application for which documents need to be tracked.
When a record is input in an application, documents would be tracked only if the application is defined in this file.
Must be a valid T24 application whose product is installed in the company.
Records of this application could not be reversed.
